ChaosParameters ChaosParameters Class

Definition

Namespace:
System.Fabric.Chaos.DataStructures
Assembly:
System.Fabric.dll

This class defines all the test parameters to configure the ChaosTestScenario.

Edit

In this Article

[Serializable]
public class ChaosParameters : ByteSerializable, IByteSerializable<Serializable>
Public Class ChaosParameters

    Implements IByteSerializable

public ChaosParameters()Public Sub New
Attributes
SerializableAttribute

ChaosParameters(Int64, Nullable<TimeSpan>) ChaosParameters(Int64, Nullable(Of TimeSpan))

Edit

Initializes a new instance of the ChaosParameters class.

public ChaosParameters(long maxConcurrentFaults, TimeSpan? timeToRun = null)Public Sub New(maxConcurrentFaults As Long, timeToRun As TimeSpan? = Nothing)
Parameters
maxConcurrentFaults
Int64 Int64

Maximum number of concurrent faults induced per iteration with the lowest being 1. The higher the concurrency the more aggressive the failovers thus inducing more complex series of failures to uncover bugs. using 2 or 3 for this is recommended.

timeToRun
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

Total time Chaos sould run

Attributes
SerializableAttribute

ChaosParameters(TimeSpan, Int64, Boolean, Nullable<TimeSpan>) ChaosParameters(TimeSpan, Int64, Boolean, Nullable(Of TimeSpan))

Edit

Initializes a new instance of the ChaosParameters class.

public ChaosParameters(TimeSpan maxClusterStabilizationTimeout, long maxConcurrentFaults, bool enableMoveReplicaFaults, TimeSpan? timeToRun = null)Public Sub New(maxClusterStabilizationTimeout As TimeSpan, maxConcurrentFaults As Long, enableMoveReplicaFaults As Boolean, timeToRun As TimeSpan? = Nothing)
Parameters
maxClusterStabilizationTimeout
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The maximum amount of time to wait for the entire cluster to stabilize after a fault iteration before failing the test.

maxConcurrentFaults
Int64 Int64

Maximum number of concurrent faults induced per iteration with the lowest being 1. The higher the concurrency the more aggressive the failovers thus inducing more complex series of failures to uncover bugs. using 2 or 3 for this is recommended.

enableMoveReplicaFaults
Boolean Boolean

Enables or disables the MovePrimary and MoveSecondary faults.

timeToRun
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

Total time Chaos sould run

Attributes
SerializableAttribute

ChaosParameters(TimeSpan, Int64, Boolean, TimeSpan, Dictionary<String, String>) ChaosParameters(TimeSpan, Int64, Boolean, TimeSpan, Dictionary(Of String, String))

Edit

Initializes a new instance of the ChaosParameters class.

public ChaosParameters(TimeSpan maxClusterStabilizationTimeout, long maxConcurrentFaults, bool enableMoveReplicaFaults, TimeSpan timeToRun, Dictionary<string, string> context)Public Sub New(maxClusterStabilizationTimeout As TimeSpan, maxConcurrentFaults As Long, enableMoveReplicaFaults As Boolean, timeToRun As TimeSpan, context As Dictionary(Of String, String))
Parameters
maxClusterStabilizationTimeout
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The maximum amount of time to wait for the entire cluster to stabilize after a fault iteration before failing the test.

maxConcurrentFaults
Int64 Int64

Maximum number of concurrent faults induced per iteration with the lowest being 1. The higher the concurrency the more aggressive the failovers thus inducing more complex series of failures to uncover bugs. using 2 or 3 for this is recommended.

enableMoveReplicaFaults
Boolean Boolean

Enables or disables the MovePrimary and MoveSecondary faults.

timeToRun
TimeSpan TimeSpan

After running for this much time, Chaos will stop.

context
Dictionary<String, String> Dictionary(Of String, String)

This is a bag of (key, value) pairs. This can be used to record detailed context about why Chaos is being started for example.

Attributes
SerializableAttribute

ChaosParameters(TimeSpan, Int64, Boolean, TimeSpan, Dictionary<String, String>, TimeSpan, TimeSpan) ChaosParameters(TimeSpan, Int64, Boolean, TimeSpan, Dictionary(Of String, String), TimeSpan, TimeSpan)

Properties

Context Context

Edit

Gets the bag of (key, value) pairs that was passed while starting Chaos

public Dictionary<string, string> Context { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Context As Dictionary(Of String, String)
Value
Dictionary<String, String> Dictionary(Of String, String)
Attributes
SerializableAttribute

EnableMoveReplicaFaults EnableMoveReplicaFaults

Edit

Enables or disables the MovePrimary and MoveSecondary faults.

public bool EnableMoveReplicaFaults { get; set; }Public Property EnableMoveReplicaFaults As Boolean
Value
Boolean Boolean
Attributes
SerializableAttribute

MaxClusterStabilizationTimeout MaxClusterStabilizationTimeout

Edit

The maximum amount of time to wait for the cluster to stabilize after a fault before failing the test.

public TimeSpan MaxClusterStabilizationTimeout { get; set; }Public Property MaxClusterStabilizationTimeout As TimeSpan
Value
TimeSpan TimeSpan

After each iteration, the ChaosTestScenario waits for at most this amount of time for the cluster to become healthy

Attributes
SerializableAttribute

MaxConcurrentFaults MaxConcurrentFaults

Edit

Maximum number of concurrent faults induced per iteration with the lowest being 1. The higer the concurrency the more aggressive the failovers; thus, inducing more complex series of failures to uncover bugs -- using 2 or 3 for this is recommended.

public long MaxConcurrentFaults { get; set; }Public Property MaxConcurrentFaults As Long
Value
Int64 Int64
Attributes
SerializableAttribute

TimeToRun TimeToRun

Edit

Total time for which the scenario will run before ending.

public TimeSpan TimeToRun { get; }Public ReadOnly Property TimeToRun As TimeSpan
Value
TimeSpan TimeSpan

Returns the max run-time of the scenario as TimeSpan

Attributes
SerializableAttribute

WaitTimeBetweenFaults WaitTimeBetweenFaults

Edit

The maximum wait time between consecutive faults: the larger the value, the lower the concurrency (of faults).

public TimeSpan WaitTimeBetweenFaults { get; set; }Public Property WaitTimeBetweenFaults As TimeSpan
Value
TimeSpan TimeSpan

Returns the maximum wait time between two consecutive faults as a TimeSpan

Attributes
SerializableAttribute

WaitTimeBetweenIterations WaitTimeBetweenIterations

Edit

Wait time between two iterations for a random duration bound by this value.

public TimeSpan WaitTimeBetweenIterations { get; set; }Public Property WaitTimeBetweenIterations As TimeSpan
Value
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The time-separation between two consecutive iterations of the ChaosTestScenario

SerializableAttribute
